intro: Gagea wallichii, commonly known as the Himalayan spring bulb, is a perennial herbaceous plant native to the mountainous regions of Asia. It belongs to the Liliaceae family and is characterized by its small, clustered bulbs and grass-like leaves. The plant produces delicate, bell-shaped flowers that are typically white or pale pink, blooming in early spring. Gagea wallichii thrives in cool, moist environments and is often found in alpine meadows and rocky slopes. Its botanical features make it a distinctive and valuable species in high-altitude flora.
